documentation.text:
@dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by
 a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.
@dev Returns the amount of amount in existence.
@dev Returns the amount of amount owned by `account`.

@dev Returns the remaining number of amount that `spender` will be
 allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is
 zero by default.
 This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

@dev Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's amount.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
 that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
 transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
 condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
 desired value afterwards:
 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
 Emits an {Approval} event.

@dev Moves `amount` amount from `from` to `to` using the
 allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: mint to the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: mint to the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: mint to the zero address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Only the minter can use this function."

arguments.value: Only the minter can use this function.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Only the minter can use this function."

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` amount are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of amount that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's amount. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the amount of amount owned by `account`.

totalSupply().details: Returns the amount of amount in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` amount from the caller's account to `to`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` amount from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.
